title: Feldspar
summary: Feldspars are a group of rock-forming aluminium tectosilicate minerals, containing sodium, calcium, potassium or barium.[2] The most common members of the feldspar group are the plagioclase (sodium-calcium) feldspars and the alkali (potassium-sodium) feldspars.[3] Feldspars make up about 60% of the Earth's crust,[2] and 41% of the Earth's continental crust by weight.[4][5]
